summary.para: Gets the border space allocated for the specified object.

param.name: punkObj
param.para: Pointer to the object for which the border space is being requested.

param.name: prcBorder
param.para: Pointer to a structure that, when this method returns successfully, receives the entire available border space for the browser. The docking window object should use this information to determine where to place itself. See the method for more information.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Approves, modifies, or refuses a request for an object's border space. The border space is not allocated until the method is called.

param.name: punkObj
param.para: Pointer to the object for which the border space is being requested.

param.name: pbw
param.para: A pointer to a BORDERWIDTHS structure. Before calling this method, the structure must be filled with the desired border space. After the method returns successfully, the structure contains the approved border space. The object may change these values. If border space is critical, it is the caller's responsibility to determine if the returned border space is sufficient.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the border space request is approved or modified, or an error value otherwise.

summary.para: Allocates and reserves border space for an object.

param.name: punkObj
param.para: A pointer to the object for which the border space is being set.

param.name: pbw
param.para: A pointer to a BORDERWIDTHS structure that contains the coordinates of the object's border space. The border space should be approved through a successful call to the method before SetBorderSpaceDW is called with these coordinates.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Exposes methods that manage the border space for one or more objects. This interface is implemented by the browser and is similar to the interface.

remarks.para: IDockingWindowSite is derived from . See the following topics for details on these methods also available to IDockingWindowSite through that inheritance.
You do not typically implement the IDockingWindowSite interface. The Shell browser implements this interface to support docked windows inside the browser frame.
You use IDockingWindowSite to negotiate the space for a docking window object in a browser frame.
